pageContent: English translation of Holy Guru Granth Sahib (Part 33)

Raag Kalyaan − Part 001 1319 : 1 Raag Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1319 : 2 One Universal Creator God. Truth Is The Name. Creative Being Personified. No Fear. No Hatred. Image Of The Undying. Beyond Birth. Self−Existent. By Guru's Grace: 1319 : 3 The Lord, the Beauteous Lord − no one has found His limits. 1319 : 4 I am a child − You cherish and sustain me. You are the Great Primal Being, my Mother and Father. ||1||Pause|| 1319 : 5 The Names of the Lord are Countless and Unfathomable. My Sovereign Lord is Unfathomable and Incomprehensible. 1319 : 6 The virtuous and the spiritual teachers have given it great thought, but they have not found even an iota of His Value. ||1|| 1319 : 7 They sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord, the Lord of the Universe forever. They sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the Universe, but they do not find His limits. 1319 : 8 You are Immeasurable, Unweighable, and Infinite, O Lord and Master; no matter how much one may meditate on You, Your Depth cannot be fathomed. ||2|| 2

1319 : 9 Lord, Your humble servants praise You, singing Your Glorious Praises, O Sovereign Lord. 1319 : 10 You are the ocean of water, and I am Your fish. No one has ever found Your limits. ||3|| 1319 : 11 Please be Kind to Your humble servant, Lord; please bless me with the meditation of Your Name. 1319 : 12 I am a blind fool; Your Name is my only Support. Servant Nanak, as Gurmukh, has found it. ||4||1|| 1319 : 13 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1319 : 14 The humble servant of the Lord sings the Lord's Praise, and blossoms forth. 1319 : 15 My intellect is embellished with devotion to the Lord, Har, Har, through the Guru's Teachings. This is the destiny which God has recorded on my forehead. ||1||Pause|| 1319 : 16 I meditate in remembrance on the Guru's Feet, day and night. The Lord, Har, Har, Har, comes to dwell in my mind. 1319 : 17 The Praise of the Lord, Har, Har, Har, is Excellent and Sublime in this world. His Praise is the sandalwood paste which I rub. ||1|| Raag Kalyaan − Part 001 3

1319 : 18 The humble servant of the Lord is lovingly attuned to the Lord, Har, Har, Har; all the faithless cynics pursue him. 1319 : 19 The slanderous person acts in accordance with the record of his past deeds; his foot trips over the snake, and he is stung by its bite. ||2|| 1319 : 20 O my Lord and Master, You are the Saving Grace, the Protector of Your humble servants. You protect them, age after age. 1319 : 21 What does it matter, if a demon speaks evil? By doing so, he only gets frustrated. ||3|| 1319 : 22 All the beings and creatures created by God are caught in the mouth of Death. 1319 : 23 The humble servants of the Lord are protected by the Lord God, Har, Har, Har; servant Nanak seeks His Sanctuary. ||4||2|| 1319 : 24 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 001 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 001 4

Raag Kalyaan − Part 002 1320 : 25 O my mind, chant and meditate on the Master of the Universe. 1320 : 26 Through the Guru's Teachings, meditate on the Lord's Name, and be rid of all the painful past sins. ||1||Pause|| 1320 : 27 I have only one tongue − I cannot sing His Praises. Please bless me with many, many tongues. 1320 : 28 Again and again, each and every instant, with all of them, I would sing His Glorious Praises; but even then, I would not be able to sing all of Your Praises, God. ||1|| 1320 : 29 I am so deeply in love with God, my Lord and Master; I long to see God's Vision. 1320 : 30 You are the Great Giver of all beings and creatures; only You know our inner pain. ||2|| 1320 : 31 If only someone would show me the Way, the Path of God. Tell me − what could I give him? 1320 : 32 I would surrender, offer and dedicate all my body and mind to him; if only someone would unite me in God's Union! ||3|| 5

1320 : 33 The Glorious Praises of the Lord are so many and numerous; I can describe only a tiny bit of them. 1320 : 34 My intellect is under Your control, God; You are the All−powerful Lord God of servant Nanak. ||4||3|| 1320 : 35 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1320 : 36 O my mind, chant the Glorious Praises of the Lord, which are said to be inexpressible. 1320 : 37 Rightousness and Dharmic faith, success and prosperity, pleasure, the fulfillment of desires and liberation − all follow the humble servant of the Lord like a shadow. ||1||Pause|| 1320 : 38 That humble servant of the Lord who has such good fortune written on his forehead meditates on the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 1320 : 39 In that Court, where God calls for the accounts, there, you shall be saved only by meditating on the Naam, the Name of the Lord. ||1|| 1320 : 40 I am stained with the filth of the mistakes of countless lifetimes, the pain and pollution of egotism. 1320 : 41 Raag Kalyaan − Part 002 6

Showering His Mercy, the Guru bathed me in the Water of the Lord, and all my sins and mistakes were taken away. ||2|| 1320 : 42 God, our Lord and Master, is deep within the hearts of His humble servants. They vibrate the Naam, the Name of the Lord, Har, Har. 1320 : 43 And when that very last moment comes, then the Naam is our Best Friend and Protector. ||3|| 1320 : 44 Your humble servants sing Your Praises, O Lord, Har, Har; they chant and meditate on the Lord God, the Master of the Universe. 1320 : 45 O God, my Saving Grace, Lord and Master of servant Nanak, please save me, the sinking stone. ||4||4|| 1320 : 46 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1320 : 47 Only the Lord God knows my innermost thoughts. 1320 : 48 If someone slanders the humble servant of the Lord, God does not believe even a tiny bit of what he says. ||1||Pause|| 1320 : 49 So give up everything else, and serve the Imperishable; The Lord God, our Lord and Master, is the Highest of all. Raag Kalyaan − Part 002 7

1320 : 50 When you serve the Lord, Death cannot even see you. It comes and falls at the feet of those who know the Lord. ||1|| 1320 : 51 Those whom my Lord and Master protects − a balanced wisdom comes to their ears. 1320 : 52 No one can equal them; their devotional worship is accepted by my God. ||2|| 1320 : 53 So behold the Wondrous and Amazing Play of the Lord. In an instant, He distinguishes the genuine from the counterfeit. 1320 : 54 And that is why His humble servant is in bliss. Those of pure heart meet together, while the evil ones regret and repent. ||3|| 1320 : 55 Lord, You are the Great Giver, our All−powerful Lord and Master; O Lord, I beg for only one gift from You. 1320 : 56 Lord, please bless servant Nanak with Your Grace, that Your Feet may abide forever within my heart. ||4||5|| −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 002 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 002 8

Raag Kalyaan − Part 003 1321 : 57 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1321 : 58 O God, Treasure of Mercy, please bless me, that I may sing the Glorious Praises of the Lord. 1321 : 59 I always place my hopes in You; O God, when will you take me in Your Embrace? ||1||Pause|| 1321 : 60 I am a foolish and ignorant child; Father, please teach me! 1321 : 61 Your child makes mistakes again and again, but still, You are pleased with him, O Father of the Universe. ||1|| 1321 : 62 Whatever You give me, O my Lord and Master − that is what I receive. 1321 : 63 There is no other place where I can go. ||2|| 1321 : 64 Those devotees who are pleasing to the Lord − the Lord is pleasing to them. 1321 : 65 9

Their light merges into the Light; the lights are merged and blended together. ||3|| 1321 : 66 The Lord Himself has shown mercy; He lovingly attunes me to Himself. 1321 : 67 Servant Nanak seeks the Sanctuary of the Door of the Lord, who protects his honor. ||4||6|| 1321 : 68 First Set Of Six|| 1321 : 69 Kalyaan Bhopaalee, Fourth Mehl: 1321 : 70 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1321 : 71 O Supreme Lord God, Transcendent Lord and Master, Destroyer of pain, Transcendental Lord God. 1321 : 72 All Your devotees beg of You. Ocean of peace, carry us across the terrifying world−ocean; You are the Wish−fulfilling Jewel. ||1||Pause|| 1321 : 73 Merciful to the meek and poor, Lord of the world, Support of the earth, Inner−knower, Searcher of hearts, Lord of the Universe. 1321 : 74 Raag Kalyaan − Part 003 10

Those who meditate on the Supreme Lord become fearless. Through the Wisdom of the Guru's Teachings, they meditate on the Lord, the Liberator Lord. ||1|| 1321 : 75 Those who come to Sanctuary at the Feet of the Lord of the Universe − those humble beings cross over the terrifying world−ocean. 1321 : 76 The Lord preserves the honor of His humble devotees; O servant Nanak, the Lord Himself showers them with His Grace. ||2||1||7|| 1321 : 77 Raag Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl, First House: 1321 : 78 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1321 : 79 Please grant me this blessing: 1321 : 80 May the bumble−bee of my mind be immersed again and again in the Honey of Your Lotus Feet. ||1||Pause|| 1321 : 81 I am not concerned with any other water; please bless this songbird with a Drop of Your Water, Lord. ||1|| 1321 : 82 Unless I meet my Lord, I am not satisfied. Nanak lives, gazing upon the Blessed Vision of His Darshan. ||2||1|| Raag Kalyaan − Part 003 11

1321 : 83 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1321 : 84 This beggar begs and begs for Your Name, Lord. 1321 : 85 You are the Support of all, the Master of all, the Giver of absolute peace. ||1||Pause|| 1321 : 86 So many, so very many, beg for charity at Your Door; they receive only what You are pleased to give. ||1|| 1321 : 87 Fruitful, fruitful, fruitful is the Blessed Vision of His Darshan; touching His Touch, I sing His Glorious Praises. 1321 : 88 O Nanak, one's essence is blended into the Essence; the diamond of the mind is pierced through by the Diamond of the Lord. ||2||2|| −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 003 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 003 12

Raag Kalyaan − Part 004 1322 : 89 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1322 : 90 O, the Wondrous Glory of my Beloved! 1322 : 91 My mind is rejuvenated forever by His Wondrous Love. ||1||Pause|| 1322 : 92 Brahma, Shiva, the Siddhas, the silent sages and Indra beg for the charity of His Praise and devotion to Him. ||1|| 1322 : 93 Yogis, spiritual teachers, meditators and the thousand−headed serpent all meditate on the Waves of God. 1322 : 94 Says Nanak, I am a sacrifice to the Saints, who are the Eternal Companions of God. ||2||3|| 1322 : 95 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl, Second House: 1322 : 96 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1322 : 97 Belief in You, Lord, brings honor. 13

1322 : 98 To see with my eyes, and hear with my ears − every limb and fiber of my being, and my breath of life are in bliss. ||1||Pause|| 1322 : 99 Here and there, and in the ten directions You are pervading, in the mountain and the blade of grass. ||1|| 1322 : 100 Wherever I look, I see the Lord, the Supreme Lord, the Primal Being. 1322 : 101 In the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, doubt and fear are dispelled. Nanak speaks the Wisdom of God. ||2||1||4|| 1322 : 102 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1322 : 103 The Glory of God is the Sound−current of the Naad, the Celestial Music of Bliss, and the Wisdom of the Vedas. 1322 : 104 Speaking and listening, the silent sages and humble beings join together, in the Realm of the Saints. ||1||Pause|| 1322 : 105 Spiritual wisdom, meditation, faith and charity are there; their minds savor the Taste of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. Chanting it, sins are destroyed. ||1|| 1322 : 106 Raag Kalyaan − Part 004 14

This is the technology of Yoga, spiritual wisdom, devotion, intuitive knowledge of the Shabad, certain knowledge of the Essence of Reality, chanting and unbroken intensive meditation. 1322 : 107 Through and through, O Nanak, merging into the Light, you shall never again suffer pain and punishment. ||2||2||5|| 1322 : 108 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1322 : 109 What should I do, and how should I do it? 1322 : 110 Should I center myself in meditation, or study the spiritual wisdom of the Shaastras? How can I endure this unendurable state? ||1||Pause|| 1322 : 111 Vishnu, Shiva, the Siddhas, the silent sages and Indra − at whose door should I seek sanctuary? ||1|| 1322 : 112 Some have power and influence, and some are blessed with heavenly paradise, but out of millions, will anyone find liberation? 1322 : 113 Says Nanak, I have attained the Sublime Essence of the Naam, the Name of the Lord. I touch the feet of the Holy. ||2||3||6|| 1322 : 114 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: Raag Kalyaan − Part 004 15

1322 : 115 The Lord of the Breath of Life, the Merciful Primal Lord God, is my Friend. 1322 : 116 The Lord saves us from the womb of reincarnation and the noose of death in this Dark Age of Kali Yuga; He takes away our pain. ||1||Pause|| 1322 : 117 I enshrine the Naam, the Name of the Lord, within; I seek Your Sanctuary, Lord. 1322 : 118 O Merciful Lord God, You are my only Support. ||1|| 1322 : 119 You are the only Hope of the helpless, the meek and the poor. 1322 : 120 Your Name, O my Lord and Master, is the Mantra of the mind. ||2|| 1322 : 121 I know of nothing except You, God. 1322 : 122 Throughout all the ages, I realize You. ||3|| 1322 : 123 O Lord, You dwell in my mind night and day. 1322 : 124 The Lord of the Universe is Nanak's only Support. ||4||4||7|| Raag Kalyaan − Part 004 16

1322 : 125 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1322 : 126 Within my mind and body I meditate on the Lord God. 1322 : 127 The Perfect Guru is pleased and satisfied; I am blessed with eternal peace and happiness. ||1||Pause|| 1322 : 128 All affairs are successfuly resolved, singing the Glorious Praises of the Lord of the World. 1322 : 129 Joining the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, I dwell upon God, and the pain of death is taken away. ||1|| 1322 : 130 Please take pity on me, O my God, that I may serve You day and night. −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 004 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 004 17

Raag Kalyaan − Part 005 1323 : 131 Slave Nanak seeks the Sanctuary of the Lord, the Perfect, Divine Primal Being. ||2||5||8|| 1323 : 132 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1323 : 133 My God is the Inner−knower, the Searcher of Hearts. 1323 : 134 Take pity on me, O Perfect Transcendent Lord; bless me with the True Eternal Insignia of the Shabad, the Word of God. ||1||Pause|| 1323 : 135 O Lord, other than You, no one is all−powerful. You are the Hope and the Strength of my mind. 1323 : 136 You are the Giver to the hearts of all beings, O Lord and Master. I eat and wear whatever You give me. ||1|| 1323 : 137 Intuitive understanding, wisdom and cleverness, glory and beauty, pleasure, wealth and honor, 1323 : 138 all comforts, bliss, happiness and salvation, O Nanak, come by chanting the Lord's Name. ||2||6||9|| 18

1323 : 139 Kalyaan, Fifth Mehl: 1323 : 140 The Sanctuary of the Lord's Feet bring salvation. 1323 : 141 God's Name is the Purifier of sinners. ||1||Pause|| 1323 : 142 Whoever chants and meditates in the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, shall undoubtedly escape being consumed by the Messenger of Death. ||1|| 1323 : 143 Liberation, the key to success, and all sorts of comforts do not equal loving devotional worship of the Lord. 1323 : 144 Slave Nanak longs for the Blessed Vision of God's Darshan; he shall never again wander in reincarnation. ||2||||7||10|| 1323 : 145 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl, Ashtapadees: 1323 : 146 One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru: 1323 : 147 Hearing the Name of the Lord, the All−pervading Lord, my mind is drenched with joy. 1323 : 148 Raag Kalyaan − Part 005 19

The Name of the Lord, Har, Har, is Ambrosial Nectar, the most Sweet and Sublime Essence; through the Guru's Teachings, drink it in with intuitive ease. ||1||Pause|| 1323 : 149 The potential energy of fire is within the wood; it is released if you know how to rub it and generate friction. 1323 : 150 In just the same way, the Lord's Name is the Light within all; the Essence is extracted by following the Guru's Teachings. ||1|| 1323 : 151 There are nine doors, but the taste of these nine doors is bland and insipid. The Essence of Ambrosial Nectar trickles down through the Tenth Door. 1323 : 152 Please take pity on me − be kind and compassionate, O my Beloved, that I may drink in the Sublime Essence of the Lord, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad. ||2|| 1323 : 153 The body−village is the most sublime and exalted village, in which the merchandise of the Lord's Sublime Essence is traded. 1323 : 154 The most precious and priceless gems and jewels are obtained by serving the True Guru. ||3|| 1323 : 155 The True Guru is Inaccessible; Inaccessible is our Lord and Master. He is the overflowing Ocean of bliss − worship Him with loving devotion. 1323 : 156 Raag Kalyaan − Part 005 20

Please take pity on me, and be Merciful to this meek song−bird; please pour a drop of Your Name into my mouth. ||4|| 1323 : 157 O Beloved Lord, please color my mind with the Deep Crimson Color of Your Love; I have surrendered my mind to the Guru. 1323 : 158 Those who are imbued with the Love of the Lord, Raam, Raam, Raam, continually drink in this essence in big gulps, savoring its sweet taste. ||5|| 1323 : 159 If all the gold of the seven continents and the oceans was taken out and placed before them, 1323 : 160 the humble servants of my Lord and Master would not even want it. They beg for the Lord to bless them with the Lord's Sublime Essence. ||6|| 1323 : 161 The faithless cynics and mortal beings remain hungry forever; they continually cry out in hunger. 1323 : 162 They hurry and run, and wander all around, caught in the love of Maya; they cover hundreds of thousands of miles in their wanderings. ||7|| 1323 : 163 The humble servants of the Lord, Har, Har, Har, Har, Har, are sublime and exalted. What praise can we bestow upon them? −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 005 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 005 21

Raag Kalyaan − Part 006 1324 : 164 Nothing else can equal the Glory of the Lord's Name; please bless servant Nanak with Your Grace. ||8||1|| 1324 : 165 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1324 : 166 O Lord, please bless me with the Touch of the Guru, the Philosopher's Stone. 1324 : 167 I was unworthy, utterly useless, rusty slag; meeting with the True Guru, I was transformed by the Philosopher's Stone. ||1||Pause|| 1324 : 168 Everyone longs for paradise, liberation and heaven; all place their hopes in them. 1324 : 169 The humble long for the Blessed Vision of His Darshan; they do not ask for liberation. Their minds are satisfied and comforted by His Darshan. ||1|| 1324 : 170 Emotional attachment to Maya is very powerful; this attachment is a black stain which sticks. 1324 : 171 The humble servants of my Lord and Master are unattached and liberated. They are like ducks, whose feathers do not get wet. ||2|| 22

1324 : 172 The fragrant sandalwood tree is encircled by snakes; how can anyone get to the sandalwood? 1324 : 173 Drawing out the Mighty Sword of the Guru's Spiritual Wisdom, I slaughter and kill the poisonous snakes, and drink in the Sweet Nectar. ||3|| 1324 : 174 You may gather wood and stack it in a pile, but in an instant, fire reduces it to ashes. 1324 : 175 The faithless cynic gathers the most horrendous sins, but meeting with the Holy Saint, they are placed in the fire. ||4|| 1324 : 176 The Holy, Saintly devotees are sublime and exalted. They enshrine the Naam, the Name of the Lord, deep within. 1324 : 177 By the touch of the Holy and the humble servants of the Lord, the Lord God is seen. ||5|| 1324 : 178 The thread of the faithless cynic is totally knotted and tangled; how can anything be woven with it? 1324 : 179 This thread cannot be woven into yarn; do not associate with those faithless cynics. ||6|| 1324 : 180 The True Guru and the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, are exalted and sublime. Joining the Congregation, meditate on the Lord. Raag Kalyaan − Part 006 23

1324 : 181 The gems, jewels and precious stones are deep within; by Guru's Grace, they are found. ||7|| 1324 : 182 My Lord and Master is Glorious and Great. How can I be united in His Union? 1324 : 183 O Nanak, the Perfect Guru unites His humble servant in His Union, and blesses him with perfection. ||8||2|| 1324 : 184 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1324 : 185 Chant the Name of the Lord, the Lord, the All−pervading Lord. 1324 : 186 The Holy, the humble and Holy, are noble and sublime. Meeting with the Holy, I joyfully love the Lord. ||1||Pause|| 1324 : 187 The minds of all the beings and creatures of the world waver unsteadily. 1324 : 188 Please take pity on them, be merciful to them, and unite them with the Holy; establish this support to support the world. ||1|| 1324 : 189 The earth is beneath us, and yet its dust falls down on all; let yourself be covered by the dust of the feet of the Holy. Raag Kalyaan − Part 006 24

1324 : 190 You shall be utterly exalted, the most noble and sublime of all; the whole world will place itself at your feet. ||2|| 1324 : 191 The Gurmukhs are blessed with the Divine Light of the Lord; Maya comes to serve them. 1324 : 192 Through the Word of the Guru's Teachings, they bite with teeth of wax and chew iron, drinking in the Sublime Essence of the Lord. ||3|| 1324 : 193 The Lord has shown great mercy, and bestowed His Name; I have met with the Holy Guru, the Primal Being. 1324 : 194 The Glorious Praises of the Lord's Name have spread out everywhere; the Lord bestows fame all over the world. ||4|| 1324 : 195 The Beloved Lord is within the minds of the Holy, the Holy Saadhus; without seeing Him, they cannot survive. 1324 : 196 The fish in the water loves only the water. Without water, it bursts and dies in an instant. ||5|| −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 006 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 006 25

Raag Kalyaan − Part 007 1325 : 197 Those who have terrible luck and bad fortune do not drink in the water which washes the dust of the feet of the Holy. 1325 : 198 The burning fire of their desires is not extinguished; they are beaten and punished by the Righteous Judge of Dharma. ||6|| 1325 : 199 You may visit all the sacred shrines, observe fasts and sacred feasts, give generously in charity and waste away the body, melting it in the snow. 1325 : 200 The weight of the Lord's Name is unweighable, according to the Guru's Teachings; nothing can equal its weight. ||7|| 1325 : 201 O God, You alone know Your Glorious Virtues. Servant Nanak seeks Your Sanctuary. 1325 : 202 You are the Ocean of water, and I am Your fish. Please be kind, and keep me always with You. ||8||3|| 1325 : 203 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1325 : 204 I worship and adore the Lord, the All−pervading Lord. 26

1325 : 205 I surrender my mind and body, and place everything before Him; following the Guru's Teachings, spiritual wisdom is implanted within me. ||1||Pause|| 1325 : 206 God's Name is the tree, and His Glorious Virtues are the branches. Picking and gathering up the fruit, I worship Him. 1325 : 207 The soul is divine; divine is the soul. Worship Him with love. ||1|| 1325 : 208 One of keen intellect and precise understanding is immaculate in all this world. In thoughtful consideration, he drinks in the sublime essence. 1325 : 209 By Guru's Grace, the treasure is found; dedicate this mind to the True Guru. ||2|| 1325 : 210 Priceless and utterly sublime is the Diamond of the Lord. This Diamond pierces the diamond of the mind. 1325 : 211 The mind becomes the jeweller, through the Word of the Guru's Shabad; it appraises the Diamond of the Lord. ||3|| 1325 : 212 Attaching oneself to the Society of the Saints, one is exalted and uplifted, as the palaas tree is absorbed by the peepal tree. 1325 : 213 Raag Kalyaan − Part 007 27

That mortal being is supreme among all people, who is perfumed by the fragrance of the Lord's Name. ||4|| 1325 : 214 One who continually acts in goodness and immaculate purity, sprouts green branches in great abundance. 1325 : 215 The Guru has taught me that Dharmic faith is the flower, and spiritual wisdom is the fruit; this fragrance permeates the world. ||5|| 1325 : 216 The One, the Light of the One, abides within my mind; God, the One, is seen in all. 1325 : 217 The One Lord, the Supreme Soul, is spread out everywhere; all place their heads beneath His Feet. ||6|| 1325 : 218 Without the Naam, the Name of the Lord, people look like criminals with their noses cut off; bit by bit, their noses are cut off. 1325 : 219 The faithless cynics are called egotistical; without the Name, their lives are cursed. ||7|| 1325 : 220 As long as the breath breathes through the mind deep within, hurry and seek God's Sanctuary. 1325 : 221 Please shower Your Kind Mercy and take pity upon Nanak, that he may wash the feet of the Holy. ||8||4|| Raag Kalyaan − Part 007 28

1325 : 222 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1325 : 223 O Lord, I wash the feet of the Holy. 1325 : 224 May my sins be burnt away in an instant; O my Lord and Master, please bless me with Your Mercy. ||1||Pause|| 1325 : 225 The meek and humble beggars stand begging at Your Door. Please be generous and give to those who are yearning. 1325 : 226 Save me, save me, O God − I have come to Your Sanctuary. Please implant the Guru's Teachings, and the Naam within me. ||1|| 1325 : 227 Sexual desire and anger are very powerful in the body−village; I rise up to fight the battle against them. 1325 : 228 Please make me Your Own and save me; through the Perfect Guru, I drive them out. ||2|| 1325 : 229 The powerful fire of corruption is raging violently within; the Word of the Guru's Shabad is the ice water which cools and soothes. −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 007 −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 007 29

Raag Kalyaan − Part 008 1326 : 230 My mind and body are calm and tranquil; the disease has been cured, and now I sleep in peace. ||3|| 1326 : 231 As the rays of the sun spread out everywhere, the Lord pervades each and every heart. 1326 : 232 Meeting the Holy Saint, one drinks in the Sublime Essence of the Lord; sitting in the home of your own inner being, drink in the essence. ||4|| 1326 : 233 The humble being is in love with the Guru, like the chakvi bird which loves to see the sun. 1326 : 234 She watches, and keeps on watching all through the night; and when the sun shows its face, she drinks in the Amrit. ||5|| 1326 : 235 The faithless cynic is said to be very greedy − he is a dog. He is overflowing with the filth and pollution of evil−mindedness. 1326 : 236 He talks excessively about his own interests. How can he be trusted? ||6|| 1326 : 237 I have sought the Sanctuary of the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy; I have found the Sublime Essence of the Lord. 30

1326 : 238 They do good deeds for others, and speak of the Lord's many Glorious Virtues; please bless me to meet these Saints, these devotees of the Lord. ||7|| 1326 : 239 You are the Inaccessible Lord, Kind and Compassionate, the Great Giver; please shower us with Your Mercy, and save us. 1326 : 240 You are the Life of all the beings of the world; please cherish and sustain Nanak. ||8||5|| 1326 : 241 Kalyaan, Fourth Mehl: 1326 : 242 O Lord, please make me the slave of Your slaves. 1326 : 243 As long as there is breath deep within my mind, let me drink in the dust of the Holy. ||1||Pause|| 1326 : 244 Shiva, Naarad, the thousand−headed cobra king and the silent sages long for the dust of the Holy. 1326 : 245 All the worlds and realms where the Holy place their feet are sanctified. ||1|| 1326 : 246 So let go of your shame and renounce all your egotism; join with the Saadh Sangat, the Company of the Holy, and remain there. Raag Kalyaan − Part 008 31

1326 : 247 Give up your fear of the Righteous Judge of Dharma, and you shall be lifted up and saved from drowning in the sea of poison. ||2|| 1326 : 248 Some are standing, parched and shrivelled up by their doubts; joining the Saadh Sangat, they are rejuvenated. 1326 : 249 So do not delay, even for an instant − go and fall at the feet of the Holy. ||3|| 1326 : 250 The Kirtan of the Praise of the Lord's Name is a priceless jewel. The Lord has given it for the Holy to keep. 1326 : 251 Whoever accepts and follows the Word of the Guru's Teachings as True − this Jewel is taken out and given to him. ||4|| 1326 : 252 Listen, O Saints; listen, humble Siblings of Destiny: the Guru raises His Arms and sends out the call. 1326 : 253 If you long for everlasting peace and comfort for your soul, then enter the Sanctuary of the True Guru. ||5|| 1326 : 254 If you have great good fortune and are very noble, then implant the Guru's Teachings and the Naam, the Name of the Lord, within. 1326 : 255 Raag Kalyaan − Part 008 32

Emotional attachment to Maya is totally treacherous; drinking in the Sublime Essence of the Lord, you shall easily, intuitively cross over the world−ocean. ||6|| 1326 : 256 Those who are totally in love with Maya, Maya, shall rot away in Maya. 1326 : 257 The path of ignorance and darkness is utterly treacherous; they are loaded down with the crushing load of egotism. ||7|| 1326 : 258 O Nanak, chanting the Name of the Lord, the All−pervading Lord, one is emancipated. 1326 : 259 Meeting the True Guru, the Naam is implanted within; we are united and blended with the Lord's Name. ||8||6|| 1326 : 260 First Set Of Six|| −− Raag Kalyaan −− Raag Kalyaan − Part 008 33
